intro: Psoralea macrostachya, commonly known as the broad-stalked psoralea, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the legume family, Fabaceae, and is characterized by its compound leaves and small, yellowish flowers arranged in dense clusters. The plant typically grows in dry, sandy soils and is adapted to arid and semi-arid environments. It produces small, pod-like fruits that contain several seeds, which are dispersed by wind. Due to its ecological significance and ornamental value, it is sometimes cultivated in botanical gardens.
